If I could wave a magic wand and
have the perfect career for me,

I think it would be across
the public, private,
and nonprofit sectors.

I came to HBS
thinking that I wanted
to come into the public sector.

I didn't know for
sure, so I was debating
a lot of different things.

I saw the impact and
the passion that they

were doing from
the public side was

something that could be
a really good fit for me.

First week of
classes was starting,

and I was stressed about what I
would be doing over the summer

and what my career
would look like.

And I had a lot of questions
and not a ton of direction

for where I would want to
go with these two years,
and especially my summer.

I really see my CPD
coach as a connector,

as someone that I
go to and I went to

with a lot of
ideas and questions

and thoughts, someone that
can connect the dots for me

and reflect that
back to me so that I

can start to hone
in on, OK, what am I
actually passionate about?

What am I actually
excited about?

And therefore, what
should I actually pursue?

What I ended up doing was
combining two fellowships.

One was over at
the Kennedy School,

which actually led
to my opportunity
with the city of Cleveland.

And then the other
was through HBS,

with Social Enterprise Summer
Fellows, which provided me
a cohort of like-minded peers.

And so for me, it's really about
paying that forward and actually

doing that for
students here at HBS.

Being a Student Advisor was
really about giving back.

During my first year,
there were actually

a lot of students here in the
Government and Policy Club,

or actually CPD
Student Advisors that

had worked in federal,
state, or local government.

So they were very generous
with their network

and connecting me with the
right people and resources

to actually end up finding
my summer opportunity.

You truly are a part of
this Harvard community.

For me, what's next is the HBS
Leadership Fellows program,

a year-long fellowship where
HBS pays for part of your salary

as well as the organization
that you're joining.

It's just an amazing,
year-long opportunity

to work at an organization that
you're really passionate about.

The advice would be,
stay strong going

into this nontraditional
career path.

The public sector is very
valid for an HBS MBA.
